content: I've removed the tag "NGR".

The statement should mention that the (non integer) speed is expected to be floored.

The stub could be improved to properly parse the input:
loop N read scan:string(256)
should be something like:
loop N read plate:word(100) radarname:word(100) timestamp:long

What does NGR mean? Is it really relevant as a tag?

Also, there was already a very similar puzzle:
https://www.codingame.com/training/medium/bust-speeding-vehicles

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun and simple puzzle, great for learning about time conversion and sorting.
Changed the output statement to include the sorting type. 
Approved!

Very good puzzle, I believe it can be either a CoC (Fast) or an Easy Puzzle ?
If you want to add a little bit of complexity, I think you can make differents road lengths or handle differents speeds.
And I think you can add a little information on the puzzle, is the speed calculated must be rounded or truncated ? I passed all validators with truncated values

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great contribution !

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice.

You can bring the task a little closer to real life.
1. License plates can have different lengths and formats (cars from other countries or special services).
2. There may be a case when there is only 1 measurement for a car: A21-42 or A21-55.
Please specify the order for the outputs (looks like alphabetically).

Another round of statement fixes (fair warning: I am not a native English speaker):

The NGR company experiments next generation radars.
They plan to place some plate readers on the road and calculate speed by elapsed time between two points.
For testing, they put two plate readers on the A21. One at km 42 called A21-42 and One at km 55 called A21-55.

Timestamp is the number of milliseconds elapsed since January 1, 1970.
In the inputs specification, RadarName and Timestamp are swapped

* If the number of overspeeders is not needed, remove it
* You should specify the timestamp unit

The goal here is to create a group of puzzle where this one is the entry point.
New puzzle could deal about :

- managing more 'plate reader'
- - Different Speedlimit Sector
- - advanced statistics about trafic

- handling huge amount of data :
- - having a lot of trafic to make user SKIP math for slow car

- handling missing data : 
- - no longer having the radar name and so let the bot guess where the car can be.
- - having some car leaving before or after a plate reader
How about plate reader on a 2-way street so that cars can pass in both directions?

for the number Q of overspeeders,
User/bot don't need it, but i need it for the stub generator.
or i don't know how to let user push as many line he want until he say stop or something like that. Tell me how and i remove ^^

I agree for the Timestamp, i need to make it clear, i will do it soon

moi non plus ^^ ;p
Thx :D
Yep i planned to do these real life variations in next puzzle, but for this one i wanted to keep very easy and newbie friendly

Hey ! Sorry for my inactivity,
So i don't think it's easy and fast enought for CoC.
But a mentionned somewhere here, i will soon, make sequels of this puzzle with more complexity (and so probably different distance)
For the rounded/truncated i will keep this in mind ! (and yes it's truncated here as IRL it's shouldn't be a great idea to round, france law currently remove 5Km/h of any intakes for 'precision issue')

The NGR company experiments next generation radars.
i put it as a tag cause i will do sequels.

Good to know that we can parse the input this way, i will keep that in mind !
You don't need to do anything to let the user push several output lines. CG just makes sure that his output matches exactly the test answer.
Thx, i done it ;)
Given all the plate readen and their timestamp, found and report car over 130km/h -> Find and report all cars over 130km/h with their plate and speed
could even be in this one, as test/validator 4 ?
